snippet: Members of a Christian card-counting group have had to wrestle with the apparent moral paradox: Should Christians be counting cards?
abstract: Members of a Christian card-counting group have had to wrestle with the apparent moral paradox of whether Christians should be, in effect, cheating; card counting, long scorned by casino operators, is when players try to gain an advantage by keeping track of all the cards seen, and then adjusting their bets; group members believe what they doing is consistent with their faith because are taking money away from an evil enterprise.
lead_paragraph: Members of a Christian card-counting group have had to wrestle with the apparent moral paradox: Should Christians be counting cards?

headline.seo: A Card-Counting Mix of Bibles, Blackjack and Cash
